articles.author: Steven Scheer, Yomna Ehab
articles.description: Hezbollah rockets hit Israel's third-largest city of Haifa, police said early on Monday, and Israeli media reported 10 injured in the country's north on the first anniversary of the Gaza war, which has spread in the Middle East.
articles.title: Hezbollah strikes Israel on Gaza war anniversary; fears grow over Middle East instability

articles.author: Manuel Ausloos
articles.description: Israelis on Monday marked the first anniversary of the devastating Hamas attack that triggered a war which has sparked protest worldwide and risks igniting a far wider conflict in the Middle East.
articles.title: Israel marks Oct. 7 anniversary under shadow of escalating war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: In the past year in the Gaza Strip, Israel has bombed more than 40,000 targets, found 4,700 tunnel shafts and destroyed 1,000 rocket launcher sites, the military said on Monday's one-year anniversary of the Hamas-led militant attacks that triggered Israel's assault on the enclave.
articles.title: In one year of war, Israel strikes 40,000 Hamas targets in Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Inas Abu Maamar’s niece and nine other family members were killed in an airstrike days after Israel began its campaign in Gaza. Now she just wants the “cascade of blood to stop.”
articles.title: A picture of her grief gripped the world. A year on, Gaza woman haunted by memories

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian hypersonic missile struck the "area" of Ukraine's major Starokostiantyniv airbase on Monday morning, Kyiv said in a rare admission, after a drone and missile attack that also targeted the capital.
articles.title: Ukraine says Russian hypersonic missile hit 'area of' major air base

articles.author: Niklas Pollard, Ludwig Burger
articles.description: U.S. scientists Victor Ambros and Gary Ruvkun won the 2024 Nobel Prize in Medicine for the discovery of microRNA and its crucial role in how multicellular organisms grow and live, the award-giving body said on Monday.
articles.title: Nobel prize for medicine: US duo Ambros and Ruvkun win for work on microRNA

articles.author: Mikhail Flores
articles.description: The armed forces of the Philippines, the United States and four other countries began joint naval exercises off the coast of the Philippines' northern Luzon island facing Taiwan in a display of naval strength amid rising tensions with China.
articles.title: Philippines launches naval drills with allies as regional tensions simmer

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The mayor of the capital of Mexico's violence-plagued state of Guerrero was killed on Sunday less than a week after he took office, the state's governor confirmed.
articles.title: Mexican mayor assassinated days after taking office

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: The speaker of Georgia's parliament said on Monday ruling party lawmakers would move to impeach the pro-Western president ahead of a parliamentary election on Oct. 26, a year after a previous impeachment effort failed.
articles.title: Georgia's ruling party starts impeachment of pro-Western president before election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian Prime Minister Denys Shmyhal began talks on Monday with Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico which he said would focus on infrastructure cooperation, energy security and support for Kyiv's peace plan.
articles.title: Ukraine's Shmyhal discusses energy security with Slovakia's Fico
